Description: Part of a sheet of papyrus with hieratic text in black ink; part of a Late Ramesside Letter, with the first part of the text ('recto') written on the side with horizontal fibres uppermost, in contrast to the general tradition of Late Ramesside Letters in which the text begins on the side of the sheet with vertical fibres uppermost. Written by Dhutmose to Butehamon.
Excavator/field collector: Field Collection by: William John Bankes
Curator's comments: Published: R.J. Demarée The Bankes Late Ramesside Papyri (British Museum Research Publication 155; London: British Museum Press 2005), 21-24, 54-57.

William John Bankes travelled in Egypt in 1815-1818, and is known to have collected papyri at Thebes on his second journey to Upper Egypt (1818). This papyrus is from a batch of Late Ramesside Letters acquired in 1818 by Bankes.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (139357) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/139357)
Taylor et al 2011 / The history and conservation of the papyrus of Tuy (p.98)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus Black ink (smudged) Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: magic tape Binding: self adhesive tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A Curatorial condition comment: good
